name: Thunder-Thrash Elder
text: Devour 3 (As this enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This creature enters the battlefield with three times that many +1/+1 counters on it.)

editions.flavor: Viashino thrashes are led by elders who have survived countless challenges.
Viashino thrashes are led by elders who have survived countless challenges.
Viashino thrashes are led by elders who have survived countless challenges.

name: Thunder Totem
text:
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.
{1}{W}{W}: Thunder Totem becomes a 2/2 white Spirit artifact creature with flying and first strike until end of turn.

name: Thunder Wall
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
{U}: Thunder Wall gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"The Lemures had barely taken wing when the sky roared with thunder. The swarm of little beasts wavered, divided, and fell, crashing to the earth."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

"The lemures had barely taken wing when the sky roared with thunder. The swarm of little beasts wavered, divided, and fell, crashing to the earth."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

name: Thwart
text:
You may return three Islands you control to their owner's hand rather than pay Thwart's mana cost.
Counter target spell.

name: Tibalt, the Fiend-Blooded
text:
+1: Draw a card, then discard a card at random.
−4: Tibalt, the Fiend-Blooded deals damage equal to the number of cards in target player's hand to that player.
−6: Gain control of all creatures until end of turn. Untap them. They gain haste until end of turn.

name: Tibor and Lumia
text:
Whenever you cast a blue spell, target creature gains flying until end of turn.
Whenever you cast a red spell, Tibor and Lumia deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.

editions.flavor: Tracing the horizon in a dance of wind and fire.

name: Ticking Gnomes
text:
Echo {3} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
Sacrifice Ticking Gnomes: Ticking Gnomes deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

name: Tidal Bore
text:
You may return an Island you control to its owner's hand rather than pay Tidal Bore's mana cost.
You may tap or untap target creature.

editions.flavor: The dry riverbed became a raging torrent, and the Cho-Arrim claimed their prize.

name: Tidal Control
text:
Cumulative upkeep {2} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Pay 2 life or {2}: Counter target red or green spell. Any player may activate this ability.

name: Tidal Courier
text:
When Tidal Courier enters the battlefield, reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all Merfolk cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
{3}{U}: Tidal Courier gains flying until end of turn.

name: Tidal Flats
text: {U}{U}: For each attacking creature without flying, its controller may pay {1}. If he or she doesn't, creatures you control blocking that creature gain first strike until end of turn.

name: Tidal Force
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, you may tap or untap target permanent.

editions.flavor:
"Do not speak the name of the sea, for if it should hear you and rise up, no fortress in the world could hide you."
—Gimara of Halimar

name: Tidal Influence
text:
Cast Tidal Influence only if no permanents named Tidal Influence are on the battlefield.
Tidal Influence enters the battlefield with a tide counter on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a tide counter on Tidal Influence.
As long as there is exactly one tide counter on Tidal Influence, all blue creatures get -2/-0.
As long as there are exactly three tide counters on Tidal Influence, all blue creatures get +2/+0.
Whenever there are four or more tide counters on Tidal Influence, remove all tide counters from it.

name: Tidal Kraken
text: Tidal Kraken can't be blocked.

editions.flavor: To merfolk, pirates are a nuisance. To pirates, merfolk are a threat. To the kraken, they're both appetizers.
To merfolk, pirates are a nuisance. To pirates, merfolk are a threat. To the kraken, they're both appetizers.
To merfolk, pirates are a nuisance. To pirates, merfolk are a threat. To the kraken, they're both appetizers.

name: Tidal Surge
text: Tap up to three target creatures without flying.

editions.flavor:
"It is nature that gives us our boundaries and nature that enforces them."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

"It is nature that gives us our boundaries and nature that enforces them."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

"'Twas  when the seas were roaring
With hollow blasts of wind . . . ."
—John Gay, "The What D'Ye Call It"
Four little goblins, trapped by the sea. One teased a serpent, and then there were three.

name: Tidal Visionary
text: {T}: Target creature becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Beneath the waves, things appear the way merfolk want them to.

name: Tidal Warrior
text: {T}: Target land becomes an Island until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The tide of battle favors those who can swim.

name: Tidal Wave
text: Create a 5/5 blue Wall creature token with defender. Sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step.

editions.flavor:
"The floor of the sea is paved with the shattered remnants of vessels that navigated its surface unwelcomed."
—Thassa, god of the sea
When mountains ride the sea, waves live upon the fields.

name: Tidebinder Mage
text: When Tidebinder Mage enters the battlefield, tap target red or green creature an opponent controls. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as you control Tidebinder Mage.

name: Tide Drifter
text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
Other colorless creatures you control get +0/+1.

editions.flavor: It didn't do much, but the residents of Sea Gate gave it a wide berth all the same.

name: Tideforce Elemental
text:
{U}, {T}: You may tap or untap another target creature.
Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, you may untap Tideforce Elemental.

editions.flavor: Ebb and flow, high tide and low, quick as sand and just as slow.

name: Tidehollow Sculler
text:
When Tidehollow Sculler enters the battlefield, target opponent reveals his or her hand and you choose a nonland card from it. Exile that card.
When Tidehollow Sculler leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to its owner's hand.

name: Tidehollow Strix
text:
Flying
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

editions.flavor: The scullers beneath Esper keep strixes as trained pets, and set them loose when a fare refuses to pay.
The scullers beneath Esper keep strixes as trained pets, and set them loose when a fare refuses to pay.

name: Tide of War
text: Whenever one or more creatures block, flip a coin. If you win the flip, each blocking creature is sacrificed by its controller. If you lose the flip, each blocked creature is sacrificed by its controller.

name: Tideshaper Mystic
text: {T}: Target land becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn. Activate this ability only during your turn.

editions.flavor: He paints with drop and shimmer a world that exists only in the wistful heart.

name: Tidespout Tyrant
text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a spell, return target permanent to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: He unmakes the world in his own image.

name: Tidewalker
text:
Tidewalker enters the battlefield with a time counter on it for each Island you control.
Vanishing (At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter from this creature. When the last is removed, sacrifice it.)
Tidewalker's power and toughness are each equal to the number of time counters on it.

name: Tidewater Minion
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{4}: Tidewater Minion loses defender until end of turn.
{T}: Untap target permanent.

name: Tidings
text: Draw four cards.

editions.flavor:
"Though the letter was many pages long, I could tell all I needed to know from one look at the messenger's face."
—Barrin, master wizard

"Many wearing rapiers are afraid of goose-quills."
—William Shakespeare, Hamlet

"Though the letter was many pages long, I could tell all I needed to know from one look at the messenger's face."
—Barrin, master wizard

name: Tidy Conclusion
text: Destroy target creature. You gain 1 life for each artifact you control.

editions.flavor: Aetherborn patrons use any means necessary to secure victory for their protégés.

name: Tiger Claws
text:
Flash
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has trample.

editions.flavor: Cho-Arrim martial artists emulate the beasts of their home.

name: Tigereye Cameo
text: {T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor:
"An elvish adventurer unearthed this stone in Jolrael's jungle. Now it's truly fit for display in one of her palaces."
—Isel, master carver

name: Tightening Coils
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -6/-0 and loses flying.

editions.flavor: Having gone to the trouble of stealing a bident from a god on another world, Kiora was eager to test its capabilities.

name: Tilling Treefolk
text: When Tilling Treefolk enters the battlefield, you may return up to two target land cards from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: He digs his roots into barren ground, searching for old seeds that never had the chance to sprout.

name: Timber Gorge
text:
Timber Gorge enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Tazeem's embrace is harsh, but for those that call it home, nothing else will do.
Tazeem's embrace is harsh, but for those that call it home, nothing else will do.

name: Timberland Guide
text: When Timberland Guide enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

editions.flavor: "Can you build a fire? Track a deer? Identify killer trees? Then you'll never survive Kessig without me."

name: Timberland Ruins
text:
Timberland Ruins enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Timberland Ruins: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

name: Timberline Ridge
text:
Timberline Ridge doesn't untap during your untap step if it has a depletion counter on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a depletion counter from Timberline Ridge.
{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool. Put a depletion counter on Timberline Ridge.

name: Timbermare
text:
Haste
Echo {5}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Timbermare enters the battlefield, tap all other creatures.

editions.flavor: Only nature wreaks such lovely havoc.

name: Timbermaw Larva
text: Whenever Timbermaw Larva attacks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each Forest you control.

editions.flavor:
"You can't trust your eyes. A tree might look healthy, but its insides tell a different tale."
—Zahr Gada, Halimar expedition leader

name: Timberpack Wolf
text: Timberpack Wolf gets +1/+1 for each other creature you control named Timberpack Wolf.

editions.flavor: Their strength is no mere numbers game. An intangible force augments the wolves when they run together.

"The need for the pack is bred in their bones. Their true strength will not show itself for any other purpose."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

name: Timber Protector
text:
Other Treefolk creatures you control get +1/+1.
Other Treefolk and Forests you control have indestructible.

editions.flavor: In his presence, an ordinary grove becomes a bastion to turn spells and break armies.

name: Timber Shredder
text:
Trample
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Timber Shredder.

editions.flavor:
"She even had the audacity to criticize my wares as inferior."
—Old Rutstein

name: Timberwatch Elf
text: {T}: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of Elves on the battlefield.

editions.flavor: Even through the Mirari's voice, the elves still hear the call of their kinship.

name: Timber Wolves
text: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

editions.flavor: Though many think of Wolves as solitary predators, they are actually extremely social animals. During a hunt they often call to each other, which can be quite unsettling for their prey.

name: Time and Tide
text: Simultaneously, all phased-out creatures phase in and all creatures with phasing phase out.

editions.flavor:
"Time may heal all wounds, but what heals time?"
—Teferi

name: Timebender
text:
Morph {U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Timebender is turned face up, choose one —
• Remove two time counters from target permanent or suspended card.
• Put two time counters on target permanent with a time counter on it or suspended card.

name: Time Bomb
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a time counter on Time Bomb.
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Time Bomb: Time Bomb deals damage equal to the number of time counters on it to each creature and each player.

name: Timecrafting
text:
Choose one —
• Remove X time counters from target permanent or suspended card.
• Put X time counters on target permanent with a time counter on it or suspended card.

editions.flavor: Oddly, an unstable time stream makes wizards want to tinker with it even more.

name: Time Distortion
text: When you encounter Time Distortion, reverse the game's turn order. (For example, if play had proceeded clockwise around the table, it now goes counterclockwise. Then planeswalk away from this phenomenon.)

name: Time Ebb
text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.

editions.flavor: Like the tide, time both ebbs and flows.
Like the tide, time both ebbs and flows.
Like the tide, time both ebbs and flows.

"Gone today, here tomorrow."
—Ertai, wizard adept

"The ogre had come from out of the blue, so that's where I sent it back."
—Talas wizard

"Gone today, here tomorrow."
—Ertai, wizard adept

"Yesterday you were just a figment of your master's imagination. I liked you better then."
—Shai Fusan, archmage
Like the tide, time both ebbs and flows.

name: Time Elemental
text:
When Time Elemental attacks or blocks, at end of combat, sacrifice it and it deals 5 damage to you.
{2}{U}{U}, {T}: Return target permanent that isn't enchanted to its owner's hand.

name: Timely Hordemate
text: Raid — When Timely Hordemate enters the battlefield, if you attacked with a creature this turn, return target creature card with converted mana cost 2 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.

name: Timely Reinforcements
text: If you have less life than an opponent, you gain 6 life. If you control fewer creatures than an opponent, create three 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens.

editions.flavor: The gods are not always kind, but they do have a soft spot for plucky underdogs.

name: Time Machine
text: {T}: Remove Time Machine and target nontoken creature you own from the game. Return both cards to play at the beginning of your upkeep on your turn X of the next game you play with the same opponent, where X is the removed creature's converted mana cost.

name: Time of Heroes
text: Each creature you control with a level counter on it gets +2/+2.

editions.flavor: No one spoke. There was no need. The threat of the Eldrazi presented a simple choice: lay down your weapons and die for nothing, or hold them fast and die for something.

name: Time of Need
text: Search your library for a legendary creature card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor:
"When the kumo attacked the monks' sacred shrine, a mournful toll for help echoed through the forest. Thus began the Battle of Silk, which would last six years."
—Great Battles of Kamigawa

name: Time Reversal
text: Each player shuffles his or her hand and graveyard into his or her library, then draws seven cards. Exile Time Reversal.

editions.flavor:
"Optimists see the world as they wish it to be. Pessimists see the world as it is. Must these roles be mutually exclusive?"
—Evo Ragus

"Any oaf can conquer a kingdom. It takes true power to conquer time."
—Shai Fusan, archmage

name: Time Sieve
text: {T}, Sacrifice five artifacts: Take an extra turn after this one.

editions.flavor:
"I pray that I am never considered useless or old."
—Sharuum the Hegemon

name: Timesifter
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, each player exiles the top card of his or her library. The player who exiled the card with the highest converted mana cost takes an extra turn after this one. If two or more players' cards are tied for highest cost, the tied players repeat this process until the tie is broken.

name: Time Spiral
text: Exile Time Spiral. Each player shuffles his or her graveyard and hand into his or her library, then draws seven cards. You untap up to six lands.

name: Time Stop
text: End the turn. (Exile all spells and abilities on the stack, including this card. The player whose turn it is discards down to his or her maximum hand size. Damage wears off, and "this turn" and "until end of turn" effects end.)

name: Time Stretch
text: Target player takes two extra turns after this one.

editions.flavor: There's lots of time like the present.
There's lots of time like the present.

name: Time to Feed
text: Choose target creature an opponent controls. When that creature dies this turn, you gain 3 life. Target creature you control fights that creature. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

name: Time to Reflect
text: Exile target creature that blocked or was blocked by a Zombie this turn.

editions.flavor:
"Occasionally, there are those who refuse to appreciate all that the God-Pharaoh provides for us."
—Temmet, vizier of Naktamun

name: Timetwister
text: Each player shuffles his or her hand and graveyard into his or her library, then draws seven cards. (Then put Timetwister into its owner's graveyard.)

name: Time Vault
text:
Time Vault enters the battlefield tapped.
Time Vault doesn't untap during your untap step.
If you would begin your turn while Time Vault is tapped, you may skip that turn instead. If you do, untap Time Vault.
{T}: Take an extra turn after this one.

name: Time Walk
text: Take an extra turn after this one.

name: Time Warp
text: Target player takes an extra turn after this one.

editions.flavor:
"Let's do it again!"
—Squee, goblin cabin hand

text:
Flying
When another creature enters the battlefield, return Timid Drake to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor:
"I sneezed, and it bolted."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
It flees from anything that isn't shaped like a cloud.

name: Timmerian Fiends
text:
Remove Timmerian Fiends from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante.
{B}{B}{B}, Sacrifice Timmerian Fiends: The owner of target artifact may ante the top card of his or her library. If that player doesn't, exchange ownership of that artifact and Timmerian Fiends. Put the artifact card into your graveyard and Timmerian Fiends from anywhere into that player's graveyard. This change in ownership is permanent.

name: Timmy, Power Gamer
text: {4}: Put a creature into play from your hand.

editions.flavor: "Just wait till I get my Leviathan . . . ."

name: Tinder Farm
text:
Tinder Farm enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Tinder Farm: Add {R}{W} to your mana pool.

name: Tinder Wall
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Sacrifice Tinder Wall: Add {R}{R} to your mana pool.
{R}, Sacrifice Tinder Wall: Tinder Wall deals 2 damage to target creature it's blocking.

name: Tine Shrike
text:
Flying
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

editions.flavor: A new bird of prey—one that hunts sentience.

name: Tinker
text:
As an additional cost to cast Tinker, sacrifice an artifact.
Search your library for an artifact card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor:
"I wonder how it feels to be bored."
—Jhoira, artificer
"What separates us from mere beasts is the capacity for self-improvement."

name: Tin Street Hooligan
text: When Tin Street Hooligan enters the battlefield, if {G} was spent to cast Tin Street Hooligan, destroy target artifact.

editions.flavor: "Rauck-Chauv's like a holiday! Only it isn't on the calendars, and instead of dancing you knock people flat, and instead of giving gifts you break stuff."

name: Tin Street Market
text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}, Discard a card: Draw a card."

editions.flavor:
"Sometimes I stroll along Tin Street and watch citizens busy with their daily lives. It reminds me why I do my job."
—Arrester Lavinia, Tenth Precinct

name: Tin-Wing Chimera
text:
Flying
Sacrifice Tin-Wing Chimera: Put a +2/+2 counter on target Chimera creature. It gains flying. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

name: Tireless Missionaries
text: When Tireless Missionaries enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.

editions.flavor: If they succeed in their holy work, their order will vanish into welcome obscurity, for there will be no more souls to redeem.
If they succeed in their holy work, their order will vanish into welcome obscurity, for there will be no more souls to redeem.

name: Tireless Tracker
text:
Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, investigate. (Create a colorless Clue artifact token with "{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.")
Whenever you sacrifice a Clue, put a +1/+1 counter on Tireless Tracker.

name: Tireless Tribe
text: Discard a card: Tireless Tribe gets +0/+4 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "We've survived starvation, dwarf attacks, and heatstroke. Why should a little sandstorm bother us?"

name: Titan Forge
text:
{3}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Titan Forge.
{T}, Remove three charge counters from Titan Forge: Create a 9/9 colorless Golem artifact creature token.

name: Titania
text: You may play an additional land on each of your turns.

editions.flavor: Voice of the Argoth forest, defender of its creatures, and enforcer of its laws, Titania is literally an aspect of the forest itself. Her power and her very existence are linked to the land: when the forest is healthy, Titania is ascendant. When Argoth suffers, Titania also bleeds.

name: Titania, Protector of Argoth
text:
When Titania, Protector of Argoth enters the battlefield, return target land card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
Whenever a land you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, create a 5/3 green Elemental creature token.

name: Titania's Boon
text: Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.

editions.flavor: When the winds rock the trees, listen for voices in the creaking of the trunks. If you hear your name, you are one of the Goddess's chosen.

name: Titania's Chosen
text: Whenever a player casts a green spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Titania's Chosen.

editions.flavor:
"What do a hero and an arrow have in common? In times of war are many more made."
—Elvish riddle

"What do a hero and an arrow have in common? In times of war are many more made."
—Elvish riddle

name: Titania's Song
text: Each noncreature artifact loses all abilities and becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost. If Titania's Song leaves the battlefield, this effect continues until end of turn.

name: Titanic Bulvox
text:
Trample
Morph {4}{G}{G}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

editions.flavor: With natural laws abandoned, excess thrives.

name: Titanic Growth
text: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The massive dominate through might. The tiny survive with guile. Beware the tiny who become massive.
The pup looked over the treetops, eyeing the man who just yesterday had kicked her. Suddenly, her hunger was infused with pure delight.
The massive dominate through might. The tiny survive with guile. Beware the tiny who become massive.
The pup looked over the treetops, eyeing the man who just yesterday had kicked her. Suddenly, her hunger was infused with pure delight.

name: Titanic Ultimatum
text: Until end of turn, creatures you control get +5/+5 and gain first strike, lifelink, and trample.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
editions.flavor:
"Retribution is best delivered by claws and rage, with both magnified."
—Ajani

"Retribution is best delivered by claws and rage, with both magnified."
—Ajani

name: Titanium Golem
text: {1}{W}: Titanium Golem gains first strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Centuries before the first blades of the Razor Fields chimed in the wind, Mirrodin echoed with the golems' footsteps.

name: Titan of Eternal Fire
text: Each Human creature you control has "{R}, {T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target creature or player."

editions.flavor: There is no gift more precious or more perilous than fire.

name: Titan's Presence
text:
As an additional cost to cast Titan's Presence, reveal a colorless creature card from your hand.
Exile target creature if its power is less than or equal to the revealed card's power.

editions.flavor: Dust and memory are all that remain in Ulamog's wake.

name: Titan's Revenge
text: Titan's Revenge deals X damage to target creature or player. Clash with an opponent. If you win, return Titan's Revenge to its owner's hand. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

name: Titan's Strength
text: Target creature gets +3/+1 until end of turn. Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

name: Tithe
text: Search your library for a Plains card. If target opponent controls more lands than you, you may search your library for an additional Plains card. Reveal those cards and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

name: Tithe Drinker
text:
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
Extort (Whenever you cast a spell, you may pay {W/B}. If you do, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain that much life.)

name: Tivadar of Thorn
text:
First strike, protection from red
When Tivadar of Thorn enters the battlefield, destroy target Goblin.

editions.flavor: His blade came down upon the neck of a goblin—but not the one he had charged. When Tivadar looked up, the world he had known was gone.

name: Tivadar's Crusade
text: Destroy all Goblins.
